commentBody:
Replay should be repealed in all sports, PERIOD. Bad calls are part of the game, and tend to even out over time. Video can be used after the game to look for missed calls and be a teaching tool, but this micro-examination of play leads to even more second guessing and dragging games on needlessly.

A column here the other day suggested the use of replay in soccer! This is perhaps the worst idea I've heard in years. Soccer's beauty is based on its fluid play, and lack of time outs and substitutions, unlike the molasses that has become the NFL. The best solution is get rid of it, and chalk it up as a failed experiment. As I always told my players: "If you didn't play well enough to keep the game out of the hands of the officials, you've got no reason to complain".
